rule: If the given word's part of speech can be determined and aligns with one of the part-of-speech tags in the alphabetical list provided, the output must include at least two of those tags concatenated with additional characters, spaces, or punctuation marks.
validityText:
The input is a JSON-like structure with a "sentence" and a "word" key. The sentence "Le livre est nouveau." appears to be grammatically valid and does not contain any unusual symbols. The word "livre" is indeed a substring of the sentence. All rules of the specification appear to be followed.

OK
coverageEvalText:
The chatbot output provides a single word, "NOUN", which could be a valid part-of-speech tag as listed in the description. It doesn't violate any explicit rule without knowing the input sentence and target word.
OK
